author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act (MCOCA) court on Tuesday granted the Central Bureau of Investigation 10 days’ time to interrogate underworld don Chhota Rajan in connection with the murder of journalist J. Dey in 2011.

On January 7, the court had sent Rajendra Nikalje alias Rajan to judicial custody till January 19. He is currently lodged in the Tihar Jail and was produced before judge A.L. Pansare through video conferencing. He told the court that he needed time to go through the charge sheet filed by the CBI.

The Mumbai police had provided him the charge sheet only after being rapped by the court in the last hearing for not having provided it already.

Rajan told the court, “I am kept in a high-security cell and only taken out once in a week and need 15 days to a month to scan the charge sheet and engage a lawyer in Mumbai.”

The CBI also sought more time to interrogate the don for about 10 days. The court granted the CBI permission to interrogate from January 27, as he is currently in judicial custody, until February 5 when the matter comes up for hearing again.

In Maharashtra, the 54-year-old gangster has 71 cases against him, including the J. Dey murder case. Dey was a veteran crime reporter, who was shot dead in suburban Powai on June 11, 2011. Rajan was arrested at Bali airport in Indonesia on October 25 last year after he arrived from Australia, and was deported to India on November 6.
title: CBI gets time to interrogate Chhota Rajan
